body:
Hey

I was wondering, does anyone know a good recorder that can edit well? I would like to start a YouTube channel, but I don't really know much about starting it off or the little things (putting music on the background, intros, etc.) can anyone recommend a screen recorder? Also, it should be compatible with OS X (Mac). Thanks, I appreciate the help.
body_tagged:
Hey

I was wondering, does anyone know a good recorder that can edit well? I would like to start a YouTube channel, but I don't really know much about starting it off or the little things (putting music on the background, intros, etc.) can anyone recommend a screen recorder? Also, it should be compatible with OS X (Mac). Thanks, I appreciate the help.
title: YouTube?!?!?

replies.body:
I use fraps and it doesn't really take too much of your framerate away. It's super duper easy to use and from all the recording softwares I've ever tried, I think fraps is the best.

If ya don't like it, you can always try Camtasia's 30 day trial, although Camtasia isn't really as fast as fraps when it comes to saving the files and other small things.

replies.body:
on your computer search regedit, then go into "HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT"

Then go "Ctrl + F" and type dromjmfile, and on the right side where it says default, right click and hit delete. Then go into your camtasia trial.

replies.body:
I used fraps before to record, but it's not being updated anymore, so switched to OBS. I love obs and it's free! easy to use
l edit videos in Adobe premier elements and make thumbnails in Photoshop. I like both, but they weren't free.
also, once you upload a video to YouTube, you can edit the video to add a custom thumbnail then.  
have fun!!!
replies.body_tagged:
I used fraps before to record, but it's not being updated anymore, so switched to OBS. I love obs and it's free! easy to use
l edit videos in Adobe premier elements and make thumbnails in Photoshop. I like both, but they weren't free.
also, once you upload a video to YouTube, you can edit the video to add a custom thumbnail then.  
have fun!!!

replies.body: It's hard to get cracked versions of softwares on Mac. But ,as someone who used windows in the past, I think that Mac is better. It has its own programs (Made by Apple) and they are really good (Final Cut Pro X, QuickTime Player, Pixlr, iMovie etc.) And you can get every program with uTorrent. That's why, I personally prefer Mac!
